title: Inside look at Roxy Jacenko's extravagant home as she's announced as Di Stefano ambassador
text:
She's the self-made millionaire, who lives in a $6million Vaucluse mansion.

On Monday, Roxy Jacenko revealed that her secret to keeping motivated while running five businesses is her daily coffee.

The 39-year-old Sweaty Betty PR founder was announced as the ambassador for Australian coffee roaster Di Stefano on Monday.





The secret to her success! An inside look at Roxy Jacenko's extravagant Vaucluse mansion as she's announced as Di Stefano ambassador on Monday

The Sydney publicist-turned-entrepreneur showcased her extravagant Sydney home in a new collaboration clip.

The advert follows the PR maven getting glammed by professional makeup artist Max May showing off newly renovated bedroom which features a wall of designer handbags.

Their bedroom includes crystal lights, floor-to-ceiling windows, and a large walk in wardrobe.

Nice! The Sydney publicist-turned-entrepreneur showcased her extravagant Sydney home in a new collaboration clip

Fancy! The advert follows the PR maven getting glammed by professional makeup artist Max May showing off newly renovated bedroom which features a wall of designer handbags

After a quick glimpse of her daughter, Pixie, we then see the Roxy sharing a moment with her son Hunter Curtis while she works on her laptop.

Another shot shows a Louis Vuitton plush toy on top of a series of coffee table magazines and books.

Speaking out about her new role, Roxy said: 'I'm very excited about this relationship. I've long been a fan of Di Stefano coffee, it really is superb.

Working mum: After a quick glimpse of her daughter, Pixie (right), we then see the Roxy sharing a moment with her son Hunter Curtis (left) while she works on her laptop

'My life is hectic, and I schedule my days down to the minute! If I can find a moment to savour a great cup of coffee, I want to know exactly what to expect.'

'Anyone that works with me knows how much I love my daily coffee. I'm a total coffee junkie! My pick? Always Di Stefano which Oli makes for me at home in the mornings.'

Roxy first treated fans inside her lavish pad on her new reality show, I am Roxy, last month.

Designer toys: Another shot shows a Louis Vuitton plush toy on top of a series of coffee table magazines and books

During the episode, Roxy revealed there's been a lot of arguments over the design of her new home.

At the time, she said: 'I get obsessive. It builds up and it builds up, and I need results. I'm a perfectionist.'

At one point, Roxy was stressed over light bulbs in her makeup mirror and worried that they were too big.

'I actually don't understand it. I don't. It looks ridiculous. There's a big difference between light bulbs and an orb,' she said, with the pair spending $7,000 on lights.
description: She's the self-made millionaire, who lives in a $6million Vaucluse mansion.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
